topic.title: Red Hat and CentOS installation
topic.shortdesc: Couchbase Server supports Red Hat (RHEL) and RHEL-based operating systems such as CentOS.

body.p: The Red Hat installation uses the RPM package.
body.note: CentOS 6 and CentOS 7 do not require installation of openSSL since it is already included. You must install openSSL1 only if you are using Couchbase Server 4.x with CentOS 5.

section.title: Install OpenSSL 098e
section.p: For RHEL version 6.0 and later, install a specific OpenSSL dependency by running: yum install openssl098e
Some users cannot install openssl098e with this command without having administrative privileges. In such case put the contents of the lib64directory into /opt/couchbase/lib:

ol.li: Go to the directory where you extracted Couchbase Server: cd opt/couchbase
Extract the openssl098e RPM: rpm2cpio openssl098e-0.9.8e-17.el6.centos.2.x86_64.rpm | cpio --extract --make-directories --no-absolute-filenames
Move the extracted files to the /lib directory for Couchbase Server: mv usr/lib64/* lib/
